oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Inert Doublet Model in the light of LHC and astrophysical data
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ilnicka, Agnieszka
Krawczyk, Maria
Robens, Tania
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We investigate the parameter space of the Inert Doublet Model, which is a straightforward extension of the SM in the scalar sector. We apply a set of constraints both from the theoretical and experimental side to extract and determine allowed regions of parameter space. These constraints put strong limits on both masses and couplings of the new particles. We also present a set of benchmarks for the current LHC run. This work is based on [1, 2].
Comment: 8 pages, 3 figures, presented at The European Physical Society Conference on High Energy Physics, Vienna, 2015
